participant_1.name: Emily
participant_1.personality: Empathetic and family-oriented, Emily values close relationships and strives to improve herself.
participant_1.background: I need to learn to take responsibility for my own actions and stop blaming others. I am looking for a home that is close to my parents so that I can easily help them out as they get older. I'm from Seattle. I am overall happy with life. I have always been close to my family, even though we are not always in agreement.

participant_2.name: Jake
participant_2.personality: Reflective and creative, Jake has a passion for the arts and often deals with self-doubt.
participant_2.background: I've been in a relationship for 5 years, but I feel like I don't measure up to my partner's standards. I tried to make it as an actor when I was younger. I can't get enough gummy worms to satisfy my sweet tooth. I wake up early to practice my music before my sister and niece and nephew wake up. I love watching sitcoms on television.

content.text: Not much. Just trying to figure out how to be more responsible.
I hear ya. I'm trying to do the same thing.
Why do you feel like you need to be more responsible?
I've been in a relationship for 5 years, but I don't feel like I measure up to my partner's standards.
Oh, that's tough. What kind of things do you think you need to do to measure up?
I don't know. I feel like I'm always letting her down. I'm not sure how to be the man she wants me to be.
Have you talked to her about it?
A little bit. She says she loves me, but she wants me to be more ambitious and successful.
I know it's hard, but you need to be yourself. You can't change who you are just to make someone else happy.
I know. I just wish I could be the person she wants me to be.
You can be the person you want to be. You don't have to be anyone else.
Thanks. I needed to hear that.
No problem. I'm always here for you.
